column1: text

4.5. $+@Rs!! Her album is full of lyrics which flow off her lips with all the passion, 
anger, idealism, scars and hubris of untamed youth. The lyrics convey a 
quality of self truth which come from experiences not easily endured yet 
universal to coming of age. Certainly the explicit language is there, but I 
find it genuine and not forced. 4.5 stars and not more is mainly due in 
part to be a challenge for her as she matures poetically as musician and 
entertainer for her next album. I'm looking forward to more!

Great Album, Learn to use Google It's NOT stream only, as some have posted. Open your Android music player 
(stock) and make sure "offline music only" is UNchecked under settings. Now 
find this album under Albums-> and select "make available offline". This 
will download the album to your device. Once you purchase it, it's made 
available to your 'cloud' and you have to manually download it to your 
physical device. Or use the Music manager to download to your computer. 
This is the best quality you will get at 320kbps

Yep so.... First review, seriously? whining about a musicians "making a ton of money" 
(because they should all work for free?) and the money going to drugs and 
partying? Better stop listening to any music genre anywhere ever 
then....great album of you like Eminem. Google works fine if you're smarter 
than the inanimate objects (ie hardware/software) in your hand. Complaints 
are posted by people who are neither. Either you like him or you don't. If 
you do, you'll like this one too.

A Moving Album I bought my first Eminem album deep in the bible belt of rural Indiana. I 
was probably 13 or 14. My mother had sent me from my vibrant and liberal 
home state of California to live with my grandmother for the summer. The 
culture shock was resonating; I had gone from being a normal 
guy--shoulder-length hair, baggy pants, and a ripped hoodie--to being a 
pariah outcast. This combination of teen angst and social isolation is 
probably what drove me to buy this album, since Eminem was all over the 
media at that time, being labeled with every negative adjective imaginable. 
I figured we were the same. Well, we weren't. After buying this album and 
listening to it all summer, I returned to California a changed child. I 
will forever remember this album as the bell that heralded my awakening to 
the realities of the world. With deeply emotional songs like Cleanin' Out 
My Closet, about his painful childhood and the tumultuous relationship with 
his mother, and Hailie's Song, about his overwhelming love for his daughter 
and his promise to give her a good life, it's difficult not to be moved by 
Eminem's work. The interludes, brief sequences of raw emotional content, 
are just as powerful. Buy it.

Don't give 1 star b/c phone too full to download Except for 1 person, who seemed to truly dislike the music, every review

download? Except for ditz, & the proper subjective 1 star, all other 
disgruntleds need to contact Google Play Store. This space is where you 
rate the music; if you've tech problems, call support! Arggh!

Another mind blower Em has totally killed it on his 3rd album. This is definitely in his top

anything's touched mmlp, but ANYTHING is better than Encore. Just because 
he raps like he does on rap God now doesn't me we can't listen to his 
classics.

auto tuned, noddy era for rap/hip hop. EXCELLENT. "'Til I Collapse" is one 
of my top 10 faves of ALL TIME and I usually listen to 90's alt & sleepy, 
indie synth-type stuff so... Get it. Nuff said.

An old voice and a young body You know the cliche about singers who are so good they could sing the

those. This 21-year-old Englishman sounds so much like an American bluesman 
in his 60s, it's unreal. He sings, "Did I send a shiver down your spine? I 
do it all the time." I couldn't put it better! Highly recommended.

Great lyrics, weak beats. Em definitely revisits his shady days in most of the songs on this album 
but its lacking the beats. Lyrically, this album is one of his best but the 
beats are definitely lacking the punch. People are saying his flow is bad 
but I beg to differ. His flow on this album is new, which people seem to 
associate with bad. Decent album overall, great job from Shady records.

in all, amazing compilation album! Definitely worth it!

Shattered Prisma This album is inspiring and heart felt, it's somewhat reminiscent of 
2013's Prismatic album from Katy Perry. But where that album fails, this 
one succeeds. This album needs to be a little more upbeat. I found some 
songs unenjoyable as some felt repetitive. This album is well out together, 
even if in some areas, it shattered.

Loved this album! I saw someone mentioned this was more of a mellow album and yeah, it is, 
aside from a few upbeat songs (which are amazing!) But the lyrics are very 
powerful and personal and more than one of these songs made me cry. It 
could be that I'm an emotional sap and her songs from this album really 
resonate with me. Anyway, 5 stars! Worth the buy.
